article: I always carry at least $3 in my car and also in my pocket. I save it for the person who asks if I can "spare some  _  . Smiling and making eye contact, I always  _  very cheerfully with a comment like, "Yes, I would love to"  _  "It would be my pleasure". And I give them the  _  Then I  _  it with my next $3 for the next person. I  _  spend this money myself. I honor the idea that it belongs to the  _  of the next person who asks for it. Three dollars is a small  _  , yet it means a lot to the person who might only expect 25 cents,  _  when delivered with respect to them. I have also formed the habit of carrying  _  I think the needy may be able to use. I carry hats, socks, gloves, and an umbrella. Recently I  put together  some care packages for the homeless. It  _  to me that things like band-aids, toothpaste, aspirin, combs, as well as food would be of use. I imagined that they would need things that are not easy to  _  , so I chose plastic or paper containers. The folks who  _  them were delighted. But I think it's not just that I give them things that  _  . It's that I see them for the beautiful ray of lights that they are. I know that they are  _  expressions of God and that this is how they are at the current time, not who they are. I am  _  to also give a hug and a smile with the money. And I always remember it is they who bless me with the  _  to be kind! What a joy! I felt  _  good and proud of what I had done. See, that's the added  _  about completing acts of kindness --you feel fantastic.
